member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateHomeRegionControl operation. This API sets up the home region for the calling account only.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlRequest.DryRun
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DryRun.
Optional Boolean flag to indicate whether any effect should take place. It tests whether the caller has permission to make the call.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlRequest.HomeRegion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegion.
The name of the home region of the calling account.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlRequest.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The account for which this command sets up a home region control. The Target is always of type ACCOUNT.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateHomeRegionControl operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.CreateHomeRegionControlResponse.HomeRegionControl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegionControl.
This object is the HomeRegionControl object that's returned by a successful call to CreateHomeRegionControl.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeHomeRegionControls operation. This API permits filtering on the ControlId and HomeRegion fields.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest.ControlId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ControlId.
The ControlID is a unique identifier string of your HomeRegionControl object.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest.HomeRegion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegion.
The name of the home region you'd like to view.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of filtering results to display per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If a NextToken was returned by a previous call, more results are available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call again using the returned token in NextToken.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsRequest.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The target parameter specifies the identifier to which the home region is applied, which is always of type ACCOUNT. It applies the home region to the current ACCOUNT.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeHomeRegionControls operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsResponse.HomeRegionControls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegionControls.
An array that contains your HomeRegionControl objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.DescribeHomeRegionControlsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If a NextToken was returned by a previous call, more results are available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call again using the returned token in NextToken.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.GetHomeRegionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetHomeRegion operation. Returns the calling accountâ€™s home region, if configured. This API is used by other AWS services to determine the regional endpoint for calling AWS Application Discovery Service and Migration Hub. You must call GetHomeRegion at least once before you call any other AWS Application Discovery Service and AWS Migration Hub APIs, to obtain the account's Migration Hub home region.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.GetHomeRegionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetHomeRegion operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.GetHomeRegionResponse.HomeRegion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegion.
The name of the home region of the calling account.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.HomeRegionControl
member.summary: A home region control is an object that specifies the home region for an account, with some additional information. It contains a target (always of type ACCOUNT), an ID, and a time at which the home region was set.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.HomeRegionControl.ControlId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ControlId.
A unique identifier that's generated for each home region control. It's always a string that begins with "hrc-" followed by 12 lowercase letters and numbers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.HomeRegionControl.HomeRegion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeRegion.
The AWS Region that's been set as home region. For example, "us-west-2" or "eu-central-1" are valid home regions.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.HomeRegionControl.RequestedTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RequestedTime.
A timestamp representing the time when the customer called CreateHomeregionControl and set the home region for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.Model.HomeRegionControl.Target
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Target.
The target parameter specifies the identifier to which the home region is applied, which is always an ACCOUNT. It applies the home region to the current ACCOUNT.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.AmazonMigrationHubConfigClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MigrationHubConfig
The AWS Migration Hub home region APIs are available specifically for working with your Migration Hub home region. You can use these APIs to determine a home region, as well as to create and work with controls that describe the home region.
You must make API calls for write actions (create, notify, associate, disassociate, import, or put) while in your home region, or a HomeRegionNotSetException error is returned.
API calls for read actions (list, describe, stop, and delete) are permitted outside of your home region.
If you call a write API outside the home region, an InvalidInputException is returned.
You can call GetHomeRegion action to obtain the account's Migration Hub home region.
For specific API usage, see the sections that follow in this AWS Migration Hub Home Region API reference.

member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.AmazonMigrationHubConfigClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMigrationHubConfigClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.AmazonMigrationHubConfigClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:

member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: T:Amazon.MigrationHubConfig.IAmazonMigrationHubConfig
member.summary:
Interface for accessing MigrationHubConfig
The AWS Migration Hub home region APIs are available specifically for working with your Migration Hub home region. You can use these APIs to determine a home region, as well as to create and work with controls that describe the home region.
You must make API calls for write actions (create, notify, associate, disassociate, import, or put) while in your home region, or a HomeRegionNotSetException error is returned.
API calls for read actions (list, describe, stop, and delete) are permitted outside of your home region.
If you call a write API outside the home region, an InvalidInputException is returned.
You can call GetHomeRegion action to obtain the account's Migration Hub home region.
For specific API usage, see the sections that follow in this AWS Migration Hub Home Region API reference.
